BHsp, it is, I use abiword
even beginning to compare OOo to vista as a resource hog is laughable
I have partition magic on a boot disk, runs frm dos, it works fine for creating linux paritition, except for it limiting you to 2 gig swap partitions.
why would you ever need anything bigger????
BHsp, swap shoudl be 2 times total memory installed, thats a standard rule of thumb.
if you want to swap all your memory or half of when you run out yes it does.
a PC with 2GB of RAM, for example, doesn't really need a swap partition. (even though ubuntu requires one, I hear)
BHsp, depends on what one is doing with that system.
if you're doing tasks which require over 2GB of ram, in that case, swap isn't going to cover it.
I have 2 gigs and the system nevrr usses the swap, btu i dont really do very intensive things.
BHSp, thats why linux only runs resources out of ram when their used.
